p: To address both these issues, in 2010, the US National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) began investing in the development of more broad-spectrum antivirals. As with broad-spectrum antibiotics, which are effective against a range of bacteria, the aim was to create antivirals that could work against many different viruses. One company the NIAID collaborated with was Gilead, which led to the development of remdesivir.
